headline: Why Microsoft Is Urging Security Updates for SharePoint Customers
summary: Microsoft  confirmed “active attacks” targeting SharePoint customers and urged clients in a blog post over the weekend to immediately apply security updates.  The attacks are exploiting vulnerabilities in SharePoint Servers, a version of the internal file-sharing and intranet platform that organizations host on their own servers.  The cloud-based SharePoint Online in Microsoft 365 isn’t impacted, according to the company’s Security Response Center.

The cloud-based SharePoint Online in Microsoft 365 isn’t impacted, according to the company’s Security Response Center.

headline: 3 Cybersecurity Stocks You Can Buy and Hold for the Next Decade
summary: IBM helps businesses prepare for cyber threats, provides AI-powered cybersecurity solutions, and does security consulting and management.  Microsoft receives more than $20 billion a year in security revenue, which is nearly more than the top cybersecurity companies combined.  CrowdStrike's Falcon platform has a huge runway for growth.
